alert.note: Alert for New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 11:48AM EST until January 12 at 11:01PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by recent heavy rainfall rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following county, New Haven. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 AM EST, At 11:00 am EST Wednesday, the stage was 10.45 ft at the Quinnipiac River at Wallingford which is minor flood stage. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Butterworth Brook, Mill River, Allen Brook, Quinnipiac River, Meetinghouse Brook and Muddy River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wallingford, Hamden and North Haven. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
